question: Among the given pair of vectors, the resultant of two vectors can never be 3 units. The vectors are
explanation: The resultant <katex>$R$</katex> of two vectors <katex>$A$</katex> and <katex>$B$</katex> lies in the range <katex>$|A-B| \le R \le A+B$</katex>.
For 4 and 8: Range is <katex>$4 \le R \le 12$</katex>. 3 is outside this range.
For others: A) 1 to 3 (3 possible). B) 3 to 7 (3 possible). C) 3 to 9 (3 possible).
